intro: Bilabrella pseudokaessneriana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and broad, waxy leaves. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are often used in ornamental gardening. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
